snippet: Communications companies should be allowed to disclose government demands for private data.
abstract: Editorial criticizes limits placed by government on how much Internet and telephone companies can reveal about demands from federal agencies for private data; expresses support for bills in Congress that call for much greater disclosure about data that companies have been ordered to turn over.
lead_paragraph: Communications companies should be allowed to disclose government demands for private data.

headline.main: Making Surveillance a Little Less Opaque
headline.print_headline: Making Surveillance a Little Less Opaque
